content: TOKYO  Oct 30 Nomura Holdings Inc on Monday said its second-quarter net profit fell 15 percent  as its wholesale division was hit by a drop in fixed income trading. Japan's biggest brokerage and investment banking group said in a statement that its July-September net profit fell to 51.9 billion yen ($457 million)  from 61.2 billion yen a year ago.
